text: Sola David-Borha is the Chairman of the Board of Stanbic IBTC Holdings Plc. She won the Business Woman of the Year for Africa category at the All Africa Business Leaders Awards in 2016. ==Education== Borha graduated with a bachelor's degree in Economics from University of Ibadan, and a masters degree from the University of Manchester. ==Career== Borha started her career at Sterling Bank (then NAL Merchant Bank) in 1984. In 2024, Borha was appointed the chairman of the Board of Stanbic IBTC Holdings. Prior to this position, she was the Chief Executive of this Holdings. She serves as the Chairperson of the Private Investors for Africa (PIA), an Independent Non-Executive Director of Coca-Cola HBC. ==References== Category:Living people
title: Sola David-Borha
